page.title: 09Services
page.content: In Sedgebrook village there is a post office with an adjacent general store. On the A.52 there is a petrol station, motor repair garage and cafe. Four buses pass through the village each day travelling between Grantham and Nottingham. There is one telephone kiosk in the village. In Barrowby village there is one telephone box at the junction of Casthorpe Road and Low Road. The ambulance service and fire brigade, if required, operate from Grantham. Refuse is collected every Monday from both villages by Exclusive Cleaning Service of Grantham. The streets of Barrowby are swept every Wednesday by the same firm. A mobile library visits Barrowby every second Wednesday (l2.30.p.m. at the school) and Sedgebrook every second Thursday (on the village green).
